item.name: Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.

item.name: Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

summary.text: Amends the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to authorize the President to provide: (1) hazard mitigation assistance in any area in which fire management assistance was provided, whether or not a major disaster had been declared; and (2) fire management assistance in any area in which hazard mitigation assistance was provided.

bill.title: A bill to authorize the Federal Emergency Management Agency to award mitigation financial assistance in certain areas affected by wildfire.

item.title: A bill to authorize the Federal Emergency Management Agency to award mitigation financial assistance in certain areas affected by wildfire.
A bill to authorize the Federal Emergency Management Agency to award mitigation financial assistance in certain areas affected by wildfire.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
